resources.controller

Class MainScreenController

  • java.lang.Object
    • resources.controller.MainScreenController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.fxml.Initializable

    public class MainScreenController
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
    This class takes executes of all the actions initiated from the Main UI

      • newOrModPartStageLoader

                                     java.lang.String fxmlLocationString,
                                     java.lang.String windowTitleString,
                                     java.lang.String methodUseIndicator)

        Uses Method:
        • newPopUpWindowConfig(JFXButton, String, FXMLLoader)
        • getFxmlLoader(String)
        Parameters:
        clickedJFXButton - Which button was clicked, new part button or modify the part button
        fxmlLocationString - the PATH of the FXML file
        windowTitleString - The title of the window and screen
        methodUseIndicator - The way in which the method is used activates certain code withing the method to run

      • newPopUpWindowConfig

        private void newPopUpWindowConfig(com.jfoenix.controls.JFXButton clickedJFXButton,
                                  java.lang.String windowTitleString,
                                  javafx.fxml.FXMLLoader loader)

        Parameters:
        clickedJFXButton - Which button was clicked, new or modify part or product button
        windowTitleString - The title of the window and screen
        loader - FXML loader instance

      • partsSearch

        void partsSearch(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
        This method looks to see what kind of search is needed by the content in the text field. If numbers are detected in the text field then it looks for the part associated with the part id and displays it in the Table View. If characters are detected then it looks through the names of the products and displays the products associated with the name.

        Uses methods:
        • Inventory.getAllParts()
        • capFrstLetOfWords(String)
        • Inventory.lookupPart(int)
        • Inventory.lookupPart(String)
        Parameters:
        event -

      • productsSearch

        void productsSearch(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
        This method looks to see what kind of search is needed by the content in the text field. If numbers are detected in the text field then it looks for the product id and displays the product associated with the product id. If characters are detected then it looks through the names of the products and displays all products associated with the search.

        Uses methods:
        • Inventory.getAllProducts()
        • capFrstLetOfWords(String)
        • Inventory.lookupProduct(int)
        • Inventory.lookupProduct(String)
        Parameters:
        event -
